data.description: Business Development Representative - BackstageNew York, NYOperations and Business Support – Platform /RemoteApply for this jobOriginated from Spotify, Backstage is a leading open source platform for building developer portals. Adopted by hundreds of companies, Backstage helps customers to restore order to their microservices and infrastructure and enables product teams to ship high-quality code quickly — without compromising autonomy.Interested in helping us drive Spotify’s developer portal philosophy among the most advanced tech companies? We in Spotify’s Backstage team are looking for our first Business Development Representative to help get our product into the hands of our very first customers.Join a nimble, startup-like team of engineers, marketers, business developers, and product managers to drive an entirely new technology-focused business line and distribution channel. A Business Development Representative (BDR) is a key member of a company's sales team responsible for generating leads and qualifying prospects. Their primary role is to research potential clients, initiate contact, and schedule meetings or demonstrations for the sales team. You will generate meetings for Account Executives and educating customers that are interested in purchasing Spotify Plugins for Backstage. What You'll Do Prospecting: Identifying and researching potential clients or markets to pursue new business opportunities.Outreach: Reaching out to prospects through various channels such as cold calling, emailing, social media, or networking events to introduce the company's products or services.Qualifying Leads: Assessing the suitability of leads by understanding their needs, budget, timeline, and decision-making process.Lead Nurturing: Building relationships with prospects by providing relevant information, answering questions, and addressing concerns to move them through the sales funnel.Appointment Setting: Scheduling appointments, demos, or meetings for the sales team with qualified prospects.CRM Management: Recording and tracking interactions with prospects in a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system to maintain accurate records and facilitate follow-up activities.Collaboration: Working closely with the sales and marketing teams to align strategies, share insights, and optimize lead generation efforts.Metrics and Reporting: Monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) such as conversion rates, response rates, and pipeline velocity, and providing regular reports to management on progress and challenges.Overall, a Business Development Representative plays a vital role in driving revenue growth by expanding the company's customer base and establishing valuable connections within the target market.Who You AreHave 1-2 years of B2B sales, marketing or customer facing experience, ideally in SaaS or technology, selling to mid-market or enterprise accounts, including previous outbound prospecting experience Self-starter with the ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentA proven record of consistently exceeding quotasA good understanding of forecasting & pipeline managementExcellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to sell at all levels from individual contributors to C-SuiteExperience with CRMs (experience with Hubspot highly preferred)Strong customer orientation and a passion for delivering a world-class customer experienceThe United States base range for this position is $87,070- $124,385 plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, 13 paid flexible holidays, paid sick leave. These ranges may be modified in the future.Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us. Find our AI notice here: https://lifeatspotify.com/ai-noticeApply for this job
